title.narrative: Support to Flag State Implementation (FSI) and Port State Control (PSC) in Africa

description.narrative: The project will address the need to improve flag State and port State implementation performance as required by international instruments, taking into account the 2050 Africa's Integrated Maritime Strategy and the Abuja MoU on PSC.The prime responsibility of a coastal State is to have in place an adequate and effective system to exercise control over ships entitled to fly its flag and to ensure that it complies with the relevant international rules and regulations.

participating-org.narrative: European Commission - Directorate-General for International Partnerships (INTPA)

description.narrative: Sub Saharan Africa; although the programme has a strong focus in Western and Central Africa, the application to other regions should be possible as well.

title.narrative: Number of Port State Control inspectors trained on the procedures of the Abuja Memorandum-of-Understanding (MoU) and improved inspection standards.

title.narrative: Number of Port State Control inspectors trained on the procedures of the Abuja Memorandum-of-Understanding (MoU) and improved inspection standards.

description.narrative: Reported results indicators by the European Commission ¿ International Cooperation and Development (DEVCO) may not represent the complete set of indicators monitored for the project. The results are reported using a contribution approach. This means that where a project has been financed by the EU jointly with other funders ¿ such as partner country governments or other donors ¿ the overall outputs of the collective effort are reported rather than outputs attributed to the share of funding provided by the EU. For higher levels of results, such as outcomes and impacts, the project will only have contributed to the overall effort.
